text: following definition, \(d\) corresponds privacy parameters \((d', \delta)\) also quantified adjacent datasets (\(d'\) privacy parameter corresponding privacy measure PM). , \((d', \delta)\) smaller \(d\) (product ordering), pairs adjacent datasets \(x, x'\) \(Y \sim M(x)\), \(Y' \sim M(x')\). \(M(\cdot)\) measurement (commonly known mechanism). measurement's input metric defines notion adjacency, measurement's input domain defines set possible datasets.

text: approximate Rust documentation. Proof Definition: two distributions \(Y, Y'\) 2-tuple \(d = (d', \delta)\), \(d'\) distance respect privacy measure PM, \(Y, Y'\) \(d\)-close approximate PM measure whenever, choice \(\delta \[0, 1]\), exist events \(E\) (depending \(Y\)) \(E'\) (depending \(Y'\)) \(\Pr[E] \ge 1 - \delta\), \(\Pr[E'] \ge 1 - \delta\), \(D_{\mathrm{PM}}^\delta(Y|_E, Y'|_{E'}) = D_{\mathrm{PM}}(Y|_E, Y'|_{E'})\) \(Y|_E\) denotes distribution \(Y\) conditioned event \(E\). Note \(\delta\) privacy parameter \(\delta\) quantified adjacent datasets, done definition measurement.

text: following definition, \(d\) corresponds \((\epsilon, \delta)\) also quantified adjacent datasets. , \((\epsilon, \delta)\) smaller \(d\) (product ordering), pairs adjacent datasets \(x, x'\) \(Y \sim M(x)\), \(Y' \sim M(x')\). \(M(\cdot)\) measurement (commonly known mechanism). measurement's input metric defines notion adjacency, measurement's input domain defines set possible datasets.

Privacy measure used to define \((\epsilon, \delta)\)-approximate differential privacy. — fixed_smoothed_max_divergence
text: Proof Definition: two distributions \(Y, Y'\) 2-tuple \(d\) non-negative numbers \(\epsilon\) \(\delta\), \(Y, Y'\) \(d\)-close fixed smoothed max divergence measure whenever \(D_\infty^\delta(Y, Y') = \max_{S \subseteq \textrm{Supp}(Y)} \Big[\ln \dfrac{\Pr[Y \S] + \delta}{\Pr[Y' \S]} \Big] \leq \epsilon\). Note \(\epsilon\) \(\delta\) privacy parameters \(\epsilon\) \(\delta\) quantified adjacent datasets, done definition measurement.
